Package io.github.ai4ci.config.setup

Interface DemographicConfiguration

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Subinterfaces:
AgeStratifiedDemography, LocationAwareDemography, UnstratifiedDemography
public interface DemographicConfiguration extends Serializable
Supertype of demographic configuration strategies.

This interface declares the methods required by model builders to construct persons and to compute relationship strengths between agents. Concrete subtypes provide different levels of demographic detail such as unstratified, age stratified or location aware demographies.

Downstream consumers include the setup stage in DefaultModelBuilder (which creates person stubs and places agents) and the person baseliner which reads demographic attributes when building perâ€‘person baselines.

Extension guidance: add new demographic styles by introducing a new subtype and registering it in the Jackson polymorphic mapping. Keep the public contract stable: builders rely on createPersonStub(io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak) and getRelationshipStrength(io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person, io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler).

Author:
Rob Challen

    getProximity(Person one, Person two)
    A distance measure from 0 (distant) to 1 (identity) based on the quantile of the euclidian distance in this persons position versus the distribution of distances between location of random points in the space.

    Compute a relationship strength between two people used as an odds modifier when composing contact probabilities.

    • getProximity

      default double getProximity(Person one, Person two)
      A distance measure from 0 (distant) to 1 (identity) based on the quantile of the euclidian distance in this persons position versus the distribution of distances between location of random points in the space.
      Parameters:
      one - first person
      two - second person
      Returns:
      proximity measure between 0 and 1

    • getRelationshipStrength

      double getRelationshipStrength(Person source, Person target, Sampler sampler)
      Compute a relationship strength between two people used as an odds modifier when composing contact probabilities.
      Parameters:
      source - the source person
      target - the target person
      sampler - a random sampler for stochastic choices
      Returns:
      a numeric relationship strength
